New 1.q: Hey, how do you know my name? Have we met before?

o.a: No, I am new here. Yannick told me you could help me with some technical issues on my ship.

New 2.q: Yannick surely told you. Everyone is coming to my place for repairs but my todo list is pretty full, so why don't you just go to Gormsson Habitat and look for the repairs you need? They are usually well eqipped and reasonably cheap.

o.a: I am very sorry to say I can't. I was on my way to Lagertha Base and then my battery died. Looks like I am stranded here for a while.
Gormsson is currently out of reach for me.

New 4.q: Evening? Sneel, it's a quite early morning. Feel free to synchronize your ship's clock with our network anytime you want.

o.a: Interesting, the water is so dark even up here, not even the slightest bit of surface glow seems to reach station.

New 5.q: Ah, an introvert. You seem to be a new arrival, I saw you talking to Yannick, so you two already made friends. Welcome to the station.

o.a: Thanks. It's nice to meet you too, Luka.

New 6.q: Haha, you fell in for Yannick. That constant talk of Asmussen, but most people in the area would say 'Rasmus'.

o.a: So you think it's just some confusion of names?

New 7.q: Stop bugging me. No one – except Yannick – speaks of 'Asmussen'.

New 8.q: The former upworld people of what once was Denmark used to worship some creature called Rasmus as their God, the ruler of the water, of the seas and lakes, and of storms. I have read about it in our databases.

New 9.q: But they have the best bio-electrolytes there since EnTrOx stopped its GALAL farming intentions near Bergen and all their engineers started looking for new employers.

o.a: Haha, you are making fun of me. Why would EnTrOx give up their engineers? And what is GALAL?

New 10.q: Things have changed in the lower fjords recently. It would be too complicated to explain now. And GALAL are genetically altered algae, which are farmed and harvested for their polysaccharid polymers. The whole energy storage sector puts a lot of expectations in those.

o.a: Interesting. See, I have problems with my battery and need some repairs with it.

New 11.q: So you are in for that salvage job or not?

o.a: Sounds good to me. I'll do it.

New 12.q: Welcome to the North Sea. Eternal darkness thanks to tons of plankton, must and mud. The plankton definitely is the better one of them.

New 13.q: By the holy whale lice, no. Never heard about the algae farmers and the GALAL industry?

o.a: Wouldn't be better in times of malnutrition and deep station tantrum to grow proper food?

New 14.q:
Good one.

I have an idea: you could do something that profits both of us. There has been a recent docking accident wich a capsized dutch carrier that eventually sank directly in sight of this station before anyone could send a recovery crew. If you can salvage both of their batteries there should be enough material for your repairs and enough for me to stock up my workshop.

I can borrow you a spare low-capacity battery, but don't go too far, you don't want to end like that carrier.

New 15.q: Some old upworld cult. People say the dutch had the power to subdue the ocean, they that huge, super fast, flying ships and built the first habitats below the sea.

o.a: Super fast flying ships? Your think it might have been some sort of early dipole propulsion drive?

New 16.q: Some database entries tell about windmills, so I assume those were sorts of hovercrafts. But that's too long ago to tell with certainty.

final.q:
Great. I will equip your ship with some good old school lead ion battery. But don't worry, your excursion should not take long.

The carrier coordinates will be uploaded to you navigation system.

Good luck!

term_2.q: I am busy. Come back when you got the batteries.
